div.l: A mylnere was there dwellyng many a day
As any pecoke he was stoute and gay
Pipe he couthe Fisshe and nettes bete
Turne Cuppes wele wrastell and eke shete
And bi his belte he bare ay a longe panade
And a swerde full trenchande was the blade
A Iolye popper he bare in his pouche
There nas no man that for perell durste hem touche
A sheffelde twytell bare he be his hose
Broun̄ was his face and cambos was his nose
And pilled as an ape was his sculle
He was a markete betere at the fulle
There durste no wight hande vppon hym lygge
That he ne swore anoone he shulde abygge
A thefe he was forsothe of corne and mele
And that a slye and vsed for to stele
His name was hoten deynous Symkyn̄
A wif he hadde comen of noble kynne
The persone of the towne hir Fader was
With hir he yaf many a panne of bras
For that Symkyn sholde in his blode alye
She was Fostred in a nonnerye
For Symkyn wolde no wyf as he saide
But she were wele norysshed and a maide
To hir astate and his yemanrye
And she was proude and perte as a pye
A full faire Sight was of hem twoo
On halidayes be fore hir wolde he go
With his Typpete bounde a boute his hede
And she come after in a gyde of rede
And Symkyn hadde hosen of the same
There durste no man clepe hir but medame
Was noone so hardy walkyng bi the way
That with hir durste rage or elles play
But if he wolde be slayne of Symkyn̄
With panade with knyf or with boydekyn̄
For Ielose folkes bene perilous eủer moo
Algates they wolde that her wyfes wende so
And eke for she was somdele smoterlyche
She was as deynous as water in a diche
And as full of hoker and of bysmare
Hir thought that ladies oughten hir to spare
What for hir kynrede and hir nortilry
